page.title: 01SWADLINCOTE
page.content: {Swadlincote}is the largest town in {South Derbyshire.}It has a population over 22 500 & consists of 3 villages; {Swadlincote, Church Gresley & Newhall, adjoining with the parishes of {Woodville & Castle Gresley}to form a broad band of urban development. It is separated from{Burton-on-Trent}by a green belt and the{A444 & A50}are the main trunk roads through it. The urban area has developed in a broad east-west valley on the coal measures. {Coal & pottery}industries are still operating at{Cadley Hill. Engineering companies on industrial estates provide tanks, boilers, welded fabrications, equipment for the clay industry & machine tools. Many residents find employment outside the area by commuting to{Burton, Ashby}or {Derby.
